content: p1 ribbing all the way around continue ribbing until hat measures 3 25 from cast on or to desired length depending on if you want to fold it up or not for a smaller brim that won t be folded up i recommend 1 from cast on row 2 knit all stitches continue knitting all stitches until plain stockinette measures 2 25 - 2 50 from end of ribbing hat measures 5 5 from cast on for fold-over band version or 3 5 from cast on for non-folded 1 ribbed brim version place a beginning of round marker to mark where your row begins… up until now where the beginning of your round is didn t really matter now it does row 3 *k8 k2tog* repeat around 72 stitches row 4 & 5 knit plain row 6 *k7 k2tog* repeat around 64 stitches row 7 & 8 knit plain row 9 *k6 k2tog* repeat around 56 stitches row 10 knit plain row 11 *k5 k2tog* repeat around 48 stitches row 12 knit plain row 13 *k4 k2tog* repeat around 40 stitches row 14 knit plain row 15 *k3 k2tog* repeat around 32 stitches row 16 knit plain row 17 *k2 k2tog* repeat around 24 stitches row 18 knit plain row 19 *k1 k2tog* repeat around 16 stitches row 20 *k2tog* repeat around 8 stitches cut yarn leaving a 4 tail using darning needle thread tail through remaining live stitches and draw tight weave in ends
